Translations.Text: Say, "For myself I have no power to benefit, nor power to harm, save what Allah will. Had I knowledge of the Unseen I should surely have multiplied all that is good, and no adversity would touch me; I am but a Warner and a herald of good tidings unto

He it is who created you from a single soul, and made there from its mate to dwell with her (in comfort and love); and when he covered her she bore a light burden, and went about therewith (unnoticed); but when it grew heavy they cried unto Allah, their L
But when He gave them both a well-formed child, they joined partners with Him with respect to that which He had given them. But Allah is exalted above that which they associate with Him
Will they associate with Him those who cannot create aught, but are themselves created
And have no power to help them, nor can even help themselves
But if you call them unto guidance they follow you not. It is all the same to them if you call them or if you hold your tongue
Those whom you call on other than Allah are servants like yourselves. Call on them then, and let them answer you, if you are truthful

Have they feet to walk with? Or have they hands to hold with? Or have they eyes to see with? Or have they ears to hear with? Say, Call upon your (supposed) partners (of Allah); then plot against me, and spare me not
